borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
The proposed development, by reason of the scale, siting and design, would result in an unacceptable overshadowing/overbearing impact on 53 Tolworth Gardens, therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:

- National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2023);

- Policies D4 & D8 of the London Plan (March 2021);

- Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);

- Policies BP8 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);

- Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021); and

- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012).

The proposed development, by reason of scale and design, would result in not being subordinate to the original dwelling. Additionally, the proposal has not clearly demonstrated how the outbuilding would function. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:

- National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2023);

- Policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021);

- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);

- Policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011);

- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012); and

- Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and DMD6 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)
description: Construction of a single storey rear outbuilding for a use incidental to the enjoyment of the dwellinghouse
